Splitting our current capabilities more ways is a terrible way to justify adding a new class. If there is room for another class, you need to either add something *new* for them to do, or you need to let Kerbonauts multiclass so that they get something to make up for what you're taking away. If Jebediah was a Pilot-Explorer (gains levels as a Pilot but can also plant flags) while Valentina was a Pilot-Scientist (gains levels as a Pilot but can also restore used experiments), then there is at least some tradeoff and not a straight downgrade.

I don't think a new class is needed at the moment. In the future maybe, if new features are added that aren't covered by the current classes. For now, an idea might be to have two types of pilots: space pilot and atmosphere pilot. An atmosphere pilot would be able to use SAS in atmosphere only, while a space pilot would only be able to use SAS in space. Not too fond of it though, I think pilots are fine as they are.

"Medic" sounds too COD4-like. A more appropriate term would be "Flight Surgeon".

EDIT: In addition to dbmorpher's suggestions, I would also like to propose that Flight Surgeons could maintain (or at least reduce the rate of deterioration) of other Kerbalnauts' sanity on long-duration space missions. 

Kerbals with reduced sanity would otherwise respond sluggishly to user control, refuse to EVA, have a higher chance of failing at career-specific tasks (e.g. scientists who don't provide science boosts, engineers who fail to repair broken parts, pilots who behave erratically at the controls), or in the worst-case scenario, die / kill other crewmembers / become catatonic.
